meta.description: Disallow assignment operators in conditional expressions

content.introduction:
Disallow assignment operators in conditional expressions

Table of ContentsRule DetailsOptionsexcept-parensalwaysRelated RulesVersionResources
In conditional statements, it is very easy to mistype a comparison operator (such as==) as an assignment operator (such as=). For example:
// Check the user's job titleif(user.jobTitle="manager"){// user.jobTitle is now incorrect}1234Copy code to clipboard
There are valid reasons to use assignment operators in conditional statements. However, it can be difficult to tell whether a specific assignment was intentional.
